title: Rikafip
author: Rikafip
content: What happened: as the title says, user is advertising fake cloud mining service that offers up to 60 BTC monthly profit. Everything is pretty obvious here as we know that something like that can be offered only by a ponzi scheme, which cloud mining websites usually are anyway.User Bitcoininvester552 ANN https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5445040.0Archive https://ninjastic.space/post/61918797Flag type 1 https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=trust;flag=3136Quote from: Bitcoininvester552 on March 15, 2023, 05:36:16 PMIf you’re looking to invest in bitcoins, then I am your man. For everyone that works with me. I will give you a 100 GH/SSATOSHI CONTRACT10,000,000+ GH/SBITCOIN MINING POWERCONTRACT TIME:30 DAYSMIN-MAX DEPOSIT:10~20 BTCDAILY PROFIT:1~2 BTCMONTHLY PROFIT:30~60 BTCNO WITHDRAW FEENO ELECTRICITY FEE

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: He opened a self moderated Announcement thread because he already knows he's advertising a scam and it would definitely receive a wild backlash from the communityProfile tagged and flag supported

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: This is the kind of flag that I like supporting obvious Ponzi schemes using Bitcoin cloud mining, @coolcoinz drop a warning on that thread, hopefully, many newbies will read that warning before the post is taken down because the thread is moderated.When you are in a service section and you're an investment project and you moderated your thread then there's something suspicious on it, as an investment company you will answer all questions, and the dev of that project lock that thread because obviously, he knows that people will question his platform which is obviously a Ponzi scheme

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: whenever I see a cloud scheme, somehow the very sound of that word sets off the "fraud" alarm.I think you have a redundant word in opening this topic, fake. I'm not sure if there is a regular and legal cloud mining service at all. They all hide behind fake mining.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: I am supporting the Flag against Bitcoininvester552.I don't know who in year 2023 would purchase anything related with cloud mining (even if they are legitimate company), but in this case we see obvious scammers.There is no website with more information, only way to contact him is with email address, and he registered account in forum just few days ago, this are all red flags for me.

Maybe he doesn't know how? Anyway, I've commented there days ago and my post is still there. I think he gave up on the forum. Scamming should never be easy.Quote from: aioc on March 17, 2023, 03:36:04 PMI agree again, there's no such thing as a true cloud mining site all of them I mean all are Ponzi schemes there are no mining rigs there are no physical machines, all they have are spreadsheets of money coming in and people lined up to receive their payout, of course when the flow of money stops coming in payout will also stop, then they will shut down the site.There are (were?) cloud mining operators with real hardware, like Genesis Mining used to do back in the day, but their business model was built on taking advantage of their customers. They were mining, but for themselves, not for you, or any other person who had a contract with them. Mining contracts were there to allow them to borrow money in the form of low interest loans.

comments.author: albon
comments.body: Quote from: dansus021 on March 18, 2023, 09:57:45 AMQuote from: Bitcoininvester552 on March 15, 2023, 05:36:16 PM~SNIP~NO WITHDRAW FEENO ELECTRICITY FEEHow this even profitable to company right hahaha If I have the mining farm I would definitely mining for me itself or just open Hosting Service its way more profitable than renting out with high return like this Quite simply, they do not want to profit from the withdrawal fees of their customers or the electricity fee, as it is just a fee that may be simple. They want to steal their customers’ capital completely, and they put these advantages only to entice potential users to fall into their malicious traps. Indeed, whoever will use cloud mining and believe their false promises is undoubtedly someone who has no experience and does not have an iota of reason. Bitcoin cloud mining is common and promoted by scammers because the victims do not have the ability to check the mining equipment used. They may undoubtedly promote nothingness, and we cannot prove what they have, so these massive profits are just a trap, and investors certainly won't get them at the end of the plan.
